data.title: Pooled Tweens, removeTweens(), and remove() issues?
data.body:
Forgive me if I am not following the code properly, but I've tried to trace through things multiple times and I am still left to believe there might be some issues with the remove() and removeTweens() functions and the destruction of Tweens, in particular pooled tweens.

My first concern is that in the Juggler function removeTweens() all that it does
is remove the tweens from the mObjects vector list.
Why isn't removeTweens actually calling remove() on these tweens so that in addition to removing them from the active list it would also remove the REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER event listener (as is done in remove().

My second concern is that the remove() function (and removeTweens) simply removes listeners and removes the object from the mObjects vector, but it fails to fire dispatchEventWith(Event.REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER);

Shouldn't  Event.REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER be fired on these removed tweens. Otherwise the Event.REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER is only fired in advanceTime of the tween but with these remove calls, the tween will never get those final advanceTime calls.

As this relates to the pooled tweens, the only time tween instances get back into the pool is by getting onPooledTweenComplete called from Event.REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER but tweens removed by remove() or removeTweens() won't ever end up back inside the pool.

Another possibly minor issue is that 
tween.removeEventListener(Event.REMOVE_FROM_JUGGLER, onPooledTweenComplete);
is never removed as a listener function though maybe not as big a deal if it will always be needed

Thanks, hopefully I'm not forcing you to look at a wild goose chase that I am just not grokking the code properly.

data.title: QuadBatch is crashing at createBuffers
DisplayObjectContainer.dispose crashing
Updated BitmapFont.as so that it doesn't add the font padding to the fir...
data.body: ...st character. This can cause problems if your font has large-ish padding (e.g. for adding after effects to the font image file).

data.title: Blur Filter issue with use ATF texture.
data.body:
Hi, Daniel:

Here is a bug of ATF texture and use BlurFilter.

After update to this commit and till to latest commit.

---

git commit id: c99eb5d3af2f01515094e2c48735f8567cb56157
- added 'cache()' and 'clearCache()' methods to filters

Calling 'cache()' will render the filter into a texture once and won't redraw it until the user calls 'clearCache()' or 'cache()' again.

---

You could reproduce the issue.

Blew is the snap shot link:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/l9c69dfenvjm4pa/blurfilters%20issue.png

data.title: EventDispatcher optimization with as cast
data.body: When accessing mEventListeners[type], it helps the compiler optimize the code if you cast it as Vector.<Function>.

data.title: starling.events.EventDispatcher
data.body:
The Starling version of  EventDispatcher is unnecessary, and frankly, it makes it a real pain to implement Starling in an existing flash application. It'd be great if starling events flowed with other flash events. 

Based on the comments in the header, there's no reason for it.

data.title: Batching textFields
data.body:
Hello.

I was surprised that TextFields with bitmap font in starling never have the opportunity to batch out of the box - because of the nature of QuadBatch. When render cycle encounter QuadBatch, it call renderCustom for it, and never try to add with current batch.

I suppose the point was that bitmap fonts is always in separate textures. But I have my graphics and fonts all in one texture (that approach is fault in some way too, because small font like 12p on texture 2048x2048 size always turns out baggy, but that can be fixed. I did it with a crude crutch, but I hope in time that problem will go away eventually).

So I wanted text to batch as well, so I made this kind of change in my fork: https://github.com/grozamorei/Starling-Framework/commit/c1fd5426e2459a3293a0d4a76cf2e422270532eb. 
Very crude and simple. Now I have all I want in one batch in my app, including text.

Same goes for the text renderer in feathers.

Is this approach worth the effort, I wonder? Do I have better performance or I just making bad moves? Was separating batch for bitmap fonts intentional?

If I'm doing wrong, please tell and close the issue. Would be great to have Daniel for an answer, so I could be sure of the outcome.

Thank you.

data.title: BitmapFont Class Doesn't Support Carriage Return Character
Image.fromBitmap doesn't expose all options of Texture.fromBitmap
data.body: That wouldn't hurt to have them, or there's a particular reason?

data.title: TouchEvent getTouches() should have result argument
data.body:
Current signature:

```
public function getTouches(target:DisplayObject, phase:String=null):Vector.<Touch>
```

Proposed signature:

```
public function getTouches(target:DisplayObject, phase:String=null, result:Vector.<Touch> = null):Vector.<Touch>
```

data.body:

data.title: Starling and 3D framework = no transparency
TextFieldViewPort does not respect Starling.contentScaleFactor
starling.display.Graphics API added
data.body:
Hi guys,

We've added the old flash.display.Graphics API to Starling, as we keep finding we need it in our projects.

Central to this implementation are [Jon Pace](https://github.com/jonathanrpace)'s:

starling.display.graphics.Fill
starling.display.graphics.Stroke

These both extend:

starling.display.graphics.Graphic

which extends:

starling.display.DisplayObject

..and wraps up a reference to:

starling.display.materials.StandardMaterial

If you take a look at the Sandbox example, you'll see that the Fill and Stroke classes provide a more powerful, lower level API than the familiar Graphics API and can be used directly.

Although more powerful, this API is unfamiliar to the regular Flash dev, so in the spirit of the Starling framework we've also provided an augmented Graphics API. If you look at GraphicsExample, you'll see we've provided:

starling.display.Graphics

..which provides a higher level API that wraps up references to Fill and Stroke. The idea being that the developer could first familiarise themselves with this API, delve into it and discover lower level API.

As well as providing familiar functions such as:

beginFill()
beginBitmapFill()
drawCircle()
drawRect()
lineStyle()
moveTo()
lineTo()

We've also augmented the API to provide:

beginTextureFill()
lineTexture()

If you run GraphicsExample, you'll see the last example is a rectangle with a rock fill texture and a grass line texture.

There are also 2 other examples:

FillExample demonstrates a Fill being drawn at runtime.
And Profiling, which is obviously a performance test.

We hope you like what we've made and see it as a worthy addition to the framework!

cheers
rob

data.title: Quad width/height cannot be set correctly when rotated
data.body:
When a quad's width and height are changed, the quad is scaled  based on its current bounds.

When the quad is rotated, the bounds are no longer the same as the quad's actual width/height, causing the width/height to not reflect the desired values.

Workaround: Create a 1x1 quad, and use scaleX/scaleY to change its size.

data.title: In mobile IOS/android. The upper half of the text will cut off.
[Feature Request] Change Starling.onTouch restricting access to "Protected".
data.body:
With this change I can judge the event target is from the ui layer(flash display object) or from the Starling layer.
Then I could return some event from the ui layer.

I try to make another listener to observer the mouse event is from the ui layer then stop the event, but still have some issue which some handle need the mouse_up event form stage.
So hope will change this restricting access to "Protected"!

change:    private function onTouch(event:Event):void
          to:    protected function onTouch(event:Event):void

data.title: Tween: next tween on complete
data.body: When a tween completes, if a nextTween is specified, it is automatically started.

data.title: Tween: repeat and reflect
data.body:
Two related options that I like from other animation libraries:

1) repeat: an integer that specifies how many times the tween repeats before it is complete

2) reflect: if a tween is repeating, it will swap start and end values. In other words, it will alternate between playing normally and in reverse. Sometimes called "yoyo".

data.title: Tween: specify custom transition as function (not as string)
data.body:
The abstraction of Transitions.register() is burdensome. I'd rather pass an easing function directly to the Tween instance. 

1) Registering is an extra step that doesn't seem to add much value.

2) The runtime lookup with Transitions.getTransition() affects performance.

data.title: Feature Request : TextField AutoSize
data.body:
Hi,Daniel
Why starling.TextField has no autoSize? I think it's a important feature in Text Flow Layout to calculate dynamic single line TextField 's width

Now, When I want to get that single line TextField's  width , I had to give it a very big width , if I dont do that ,because of wordwrap is true , it will go next line

After approve, i'll write little post at forum about Maven and how peoples can work with it, main benefits and comparison with ant

Thanks!

data.title: Few words about Maven
data.body:
Hi all!

I reminding all that Starling Framework unofficially is under Maven control from Aug 19

https://trylogic.ci.cloudbees.com/job/StarlingFramework/

Here you can **see build status** (no tests for now, but i'll add them later), and also, you can **download compiled SWC** from there!

For example, **if you want latest stable build, you can get it from this link**:
https://trylogic.ci.cloudbees.com/job/StarlingFramework/lastBuild/com.gamua$starling-framework/artifact/com.gamua/starling-framework/1.2-SNAPSHOT/starling-framework-1.2-SNAPSHOT.swc

Also, there is a "Changes" view, where **you can see all changes in concrete build**, for example:
https://trylogic.ci.cloudbees.com/job/StarlingFramework/changes
#42 (Sep 10, 2012 10:35:14 AM)

enhanced ColorMatrixFilter with convenience-methods (hue, contrast, etc.)  daniel
updated filter scene with color matrix enhancements  daniel

just for you know, if you click on "githubweb" - you will see commit changelog on github. Easy, huh?

And also, builds are started automatically by commits, thanks to Continuous Integration.

BTW, Daniel, may be it's time for Maven?:)

data.title: Memory leak in RenderTexture.draw?
data.body:
I've just been profiling my application and I discovered a bit of a leak.

Within my game, I have some animated, tiled backgrounds, which use a small repeatable RenderTexture (with repeat = true).

When I do:

backgroundTexture.draw(sample);
I get this in my profiler.
http://www.tomph.com/uploads/ss_1.png

Alternatively, When I comment out this line I get:

//backgroundTexture.draw(sample);
I get this in my profiler.
http://www.tomph.com/uploads/ss_2.png

As you can see, this method is adding a lot of Objects to my application, while failing to delete all of them. I think this add/del is refreshing around every second.

(edit)

Ok, on further investigation, it appears that the nested function 'render' inside the public function 'draw' (RenderTexture.as) was the problem. As soon as I extract at make it private, the leak goes away...

Would be cool if you could fix this in the source Daniel
